hotspots.label: Black Head
hotspots.fact: This bird's dark head helps it blend into shadows and dark spaces. The bright yellow eye stands out so other birds can see it from far away!

hotspots.label: Sharp Beak
hotspots.fact: Birds like this one have pointed beaks perfect for catching insects and small food in grass. The thin shape helps them poke into tight spaces to find meals.

hotspots.label: Long Tail Feathers
hotspots.fact: Long tail feathers help birds balance and change direction quickly while flying. They also look impressive and help birds recognize each other!

hotspots.label: Grassland Habitat
hotspots.fact: This bird walks on the ground in grassy areas hunting for food. The green grass provides camouflage and plenty of insects to eat throughout the day.
